11/25/2019

Christmas Gift Guide for Boys

I don’t know what it is about becoming an adult where Christmas just isn’t the same as it was when I was a kid. It was as if some of the magic had disappeared. Know what I mean?

But then I had my own kids. And guess what? That same magic reappeared. And it is even better. Because I get to see the magic and wonder through my kid’s eyes. I feel their excitement as they rush down the stairs Christmas morning and I love the expressions on their faces as they open up their gifts.

And this year, my boys are 4 and 7, and I feel like this is kind of a turning point for them. They’re more into the same stuff than they’ve ever been before so that meant less toddler and more grade-school-aged things.

It still made these 2 the absolute BEST to shop for – because it challenged me to look for lots of non-toy items.Â  My boys still love the weird, the different, the creepy, and the crawly. So get ready for some tried-and-true favorites and some new faces. Plus, a few items that you guys have been bugging me to get links for!

These gifts will help develop creativity, nurture curiosity, and give these two an awesome Christmas. Plus, I’ve got thrills and guaranteed smiles built into this list!

See something I’m missing from my list? Leave me a comment below!

Christmas Gift Guide for Boys
1.
BITSBOX SUBSCRIPTION
BITSBOX
This gift made it to the top of my list because it's the one where my kids are excited every time it gets delivered and they're learning as they play! Bitsbox is a monthly subscription that teaches your kids how to code. Made for kids ages 6-12 years old, each level introduces a new computer science concept with a set of crazy-fun app projects that come every month! I get this for my kids and I think it's the perfect gift to give AND receive. This would be perfect for your kids (both boys and girls)! You'll never get two months the same and your kids build REAL LIFE APPS - it's kinda insane! And you can use code 'TARA20' for $20 off any subscription purchase of $50 or more!
Shop Now
2.
FAVORITE PAJAMAS
AVAUMA
I know that pajamas with candy canes and polar bears, or ones that make your kids resemble elves are super popular this type of year, but I prefer something simple and comfy - and so do my boys. Seasonal jammies tend to be cheap fabric that's itchy and shrinks. These pajamas are so soft and really hold up well. So when it comes to "Christmas" jammies, I tend to stick with simple, but timeless. Trust me, these will be your kid's favorites! Emery wishes SO bad these came in her size!
Shop Now
3.
DOG MAN TRILOGY
AMAZON
My boys love these stories! George and Harold have created a new breed of justice - one that is part dog, part man, and ALL HERO! With the head of a dog and the body of a human, this heroic hound digs into deception, claws after crooks, rolls over robbers, and scampers after squirrels. Easy enough for Dash to read and Jett to understand. These books have provided endless hours or entertainment and bonding with my boys.
Shop Now
4.
POCKET KNIFE
LOMA CREEK
Most of you probably think I'm crazy giving a kid a knife but Dash (not Jett) is at the age where a knife is something he is responsible enough to receive and taught to handle with care. If you've got mischievous boys, you might end up with a hole (or two) where you hadn't intended. But I have found, more often than not, that if you've got a kid who's a bit destructive, a lack of knife won't stop them. This comes with a fire-starter as well and is perfect as he starts cub scouts!
Shop Now
5.
ALIEN DISSECTION KIT
TREASURE X ALIENS
Gross? Yes. Disgusting? Most definitely! Will your boys think this is the coolest thing ever? Yup. You'll probably win Mother Of The Year just for putting up with the nastiness of this thing. But your boys will think you're the coolest mom EVER! They can cut open their own alien to extract a prize in the gooey innards of the alien. Think of it this way, you could be training a future dr.!
Shop Now
6.
BALANCE BIKE
RETROSPEC
This skews more on the young end but these bikes have proven time and time again to be the best bike for training your kid for the real thing. It comes sans training wheels so your child never becomes dependent on them. If you've got a kid dying for a big boy bike, this is the perfect place to start! Also, Jett loves that this one has a foot rest!
Shop Now
7.
EZY ROLLER RIDER
EZY ROLLER
Bonus with this gift: even if your kid doesn't like it, you and your husband can race on them! They're super fun, require body movement, and can be ridden in the house (or an empty basement) while there is snow on the ground. They're super fun and even the smallest of kids will have a blast on this one! We still use ones we got for Emery and Anisten when they were teeny so they last forever!
Shop Now
8.
BLUETOOTH HEADPHONES
MPOW
These are a two-fer gift. Your boys and YOU will have a good time when they're wearing these. They're rechargeable, cordless, and have a built-in mic. So they're great in the car with an iPad or for that budding gamer. And you can thank me when you can no longer hear your kids annoying games or cartoons.
Shop Now
9.
COVER YOUR ASSETS
GRAMDPA BECK
This is the one game my boys BEG to play and it's so much fun as a family. Fair warning, if you've got kids that are competitive, this game can get lively! But it's super easy to learn, fun for large numbers (just buy multiple decks), and can keep the troops entertained for hours! A super family-friendly fun game!
Shop Now
10.
ANT FARM
AVVIVA SCIENCES
#1 HIGHEST RATED AND #1 BEST ANT HABITAT: The cool blue LED lights give the kit extra awesomeness! Apart from making it look beautiful, the lights encourage ants to dig further, creating huge, intricate tunnels! This live ecosystem will be a magnificent spectacle for your kids and is bound to be their favorite educational-science game! Batteries are not needed or included with our product. The LED light simply needs to be plugged into a standard electric outlet using the included power adapter.
Shop Now
11.
ANTS
Nature Gift Store
Because you're going to need ants now that you've got the farm.. (can't believe I am linking ants... haha!)
Shop Now
12.
KIDS POLARIZED WAYFARERS
POLARSPEX
Because I love my kids, I am definitely getting them all a pair of polarized sunglasses. It's never too early to start protecting your kid's eyes and all of mine are at the age where wearing sunglasses is cool! Plus, snow glare is a real thing and can make the sun that much more dangerous to your kid's eyes! Plus, my boys want to be just like dad & these ones are just too cute! They fit both my boys so great!
Shop Now
13.
WALKIE TALKIES
Retevis RT628
K, there is nothing cooler than being a kid with a walkie talkie. Jett and Dash drag these around the house and hide from each other just so they can use these bad boys. They're really fun, make everything feel a little secret, and I don't care how old you are, talking to someone through a walkie talkie is still magical!
Shop Now
14.
OSMO GENIUS KIT FOR IPAD
OSMO
Five award-winning games that transform your iPad into a hands-on learning tool. Turns core subjects, like math (numbers) and spelling (words), into fearless fun. The Osmo encourages visual thinking (Tangram), problem-solving (Newton), and creative drawing skills (masterpiece).
Shop Now
15.
KICKBOARD SCOOTER
MICRO
Every kid should have a scooter and none are more fun or versatile than the Micro. It's got two wheels on the front for added stability and is appropriate for kids of all ages. My boys ride these around the neighborhood and it seems every kid's got one. Plus, if you're a parent who gets one big gift and then small treats, this one packs a "WOW!"
Shop Now
16.
BIG DINOSAUR COLORING BOOK
KING COLORING
Everyone in my family is a fan of coloring and this jumbo coloring book if perfect for my boys. They love the facts that are on every page and it's a great learning aid as they color!
Shop Now
17.
BUG CATCHER
B. TOYS BY BATTAT
If there is one toy I would make sure is on your list, it's this bug terrarium/catcher. Jett carried this around the ENTIRE summer. If you've been a here a while, you've seen him buckled into his car seat clutching this thing every time we got in the car. He could put all his rolly pollys and wiggly worms in here and cart them around. It comes with a net and opens at the top to carefully place all your new bug friends inside. Better in this than loose inside your house!
Shop Now
18.
BOOK LIGHT
VEKKIA
I'm a proud mom. I'm raising a few book worms and there is nothing better than staying up and reading a few pages of your favorite book before you go to sleep. But if your kids share a room like my boys do, I don't want them to leave the lights on to do so. Jett is to young to be staying up any longer and this book light is the perfect solution! This was a major hit with Emery and now it's a right of passage for every kid. Plus, it comes in handy on late night road trips when interior lights make the driver a little crazy! This one is rechargeable and amazing!
Shop Now
19.
WIKI STIX
WIKI STIK
The first time I handed my kiddos this box of Wiki Stix, they literally played silently for an hour. AN HOUR OF MESS AND NOISE FREE PLAY. Can I get a hallelujah?! I love these for church, restaurants, airplanes, or any other place you need your kids to sit silently and not cause chaos. If you haven't seen these before, they are basically wax sticks you can twist, mold, and shape into about a million different creations. Super great for teaching letters and shapes too! And this one makes the list because it has a case...and you guys know how much I love a container for your stuff.
Shop Now
20.
COLOR MY BATH
COLOR MY BATH
Bath bombs are to girls what these color bath drops are to my boys. They love tossing one or two of these (or 17 if I'm not looking!) in their bath water to make it a fun color! It's even fun to combine two colors to make a new color - educational and fun! These make a great stocking stuffer and are fun for all ages! They also have multiple sizes inside of them!
Shop Now
21.
SPOT IT
SPOT IT
This is a game that is usually in my purse or in my kid's backpack. You can take it out at restaurants, games, roadtrips, and it makes the time pass that much quicker. Plus, I'm a BIG fan of games that make it so my kids spend time with one another. This fun "I Spy" esque matching game is fun and fast-paced!
Shop Now
22.
MONOPOLY DEAL
HASBRO
Get a handy way to play the classic property-trading game! Be the first collect 3 full property sets of different colors, and youâll win the Monopoly Deal Card Game. Youâll pick up cards when it's your turn and play Action cards to charge players rent, steal their cards or demand money for your birthday. Build up property sets, gather piles of money and keep wheeling and dealing until you're the Monopoly Deal winner!
Shop Now
23.
POKEMON BINDER
AMAZON
Can I be honest? I was kinda hoping my boys would skip this stage. But the weird thing is, they hang out with other boys their age and you CAN'T escape this. So, instead of finding all those Pokemon cards lying around the house, in my car, and retrieving them from the trash, they go in here. This is SACRED. This is their home! And your boys will love flipping through their cards with this bad boy!
Shop Now
24.
DIRT ROCKET ELECTRIC MOTORCROSS BIKE
RAZOR
This is the gift that will have you second-guessing your decisions as a mother. But the moment you ride this thing the night before you put it under the tree for your kid, you'll realize you did make the right decision and that you have many more joy rides in your future. It's a great alternative to the real thing, goes up to 14 miles per hour, and is a great practice bike if your kid wants to get into the real thing!
Shop Now
25.
GIZMO WATCH
VERIZON
The Gizmo watch is perfect for when you want your kids to be able to call you but arenât quite ready for them to have access to all the dark secrets of the internet. So basically my kids will have these till theyâre 35. Really though, weâve had and loved these for years. SO WORTH IT.
Shop Now
26.
SWITCH
NINTENDO
If you are in the market for a game console and are unsure of which one to get, the Switch should be at the top of your list. Great for single play, playing with a friend, or even hooking up to the tv and playing with a group - this is the updated version of gaming we all wished we had when we were kids. Your kids will love this one!
Shop Now
27.
TETHERBALL KIT
LIFETIME
I got this for my family on Prime Day this past year and EVERY SINGLE PERSON that comes over plays it. Totally reminds me of my childhood too!
Shop Now
28.
SKATEBOARD
RIMABLE
These are the cutest skateboards. We have used the same one for years and all my kids have played with it. Great quality and even better reviews!
Shop Now
29.
FLEX RUNNER
NIKE
My boys will only wear slip ons. I think thats a mommy issue though because I don't love tying shoes. Anyway, regardless... these shoes are a favorite for sure! Super comfy and both my boys have them.
Shop Now
30.
BEANIE
CARHARTT
These beanies are the best! Simple enough to go with everything, warm, but lightweight enough to shove in their coat pockets when they're done with it!
Shop Now
31.
SCOOTER/BIKE RAMP
LANDWAVE
My friend told me about this and I snatched one up for my boys for Christmas. A few of our neighbors have this and I am so surprised by how durable it is. I know this is going to get used for years and years to come!
Shop Now
32.
DIG KIT
National Geographic
K truth moment: My kids love these. Me? Not a fan but this holiday is about them, right? We have given these as birthday gifts for a long time and they're a hit every time. You dig out 15 things... all real fossils AND shark teeth which my boys think is the coolest!
Shop Now
33.
ZINGO
THINK FUN
I got this game when my girls were little and the boys and I just played it last night. It is so fun! Basically bingo for kids. The little chips are cute & there is something magical about that teeny machine that pops them out too! ;)
